the [BBC](/wiki/BBC "BBC")'s poll of the [100 Greatest
Britons](/wiki/100_Greatest_Britons "100 Greatest Britons").[177] American
literary critic [Harold Bloom](/wiki/Harold_Bloom "Harold Bloom") placed
Dickens among the [greatest Western Writers of all
time](/wiki/The_Western_Canon:_The_Books_and_School_of_the_Ages "The Western
Canon: The Books and School of the Ages").[178] In the UK survey [The Big
Read](/wiki/The_Big_Read "The Big Read"), carried out by the BBC in 2003, five
of Dickens's books were named in the [Top
100](/wiki/The_Big_Read#Top_200_in_the_United_Kingdom "The Big Read").[179]

Dickens and his publications have appeared on a number of postage stamps
including: UK (1970, 1993, 2011 and 2012), Soviet Union (1962), Antigua,
Barbuda, Botswana, Cameroon, Dubai, Fujairah, St Christopher, Nevis and
Anguilla, St Helena, St Lucia and Turks and Caicos Islands (1970), St Vincent
(1987), Nevis (2007), [Alderney](/wiki/List_of_postage_stamps_of_Alderney
"List of postage stamps of Alderney"), Gibraltar, Jersey and Pitcairn Islands
(2012), Austria (2013), Mozambique (2014).[180]

## Notable works

Main article: [Charles Dickens
bibliography](/wiki/Charles_Dickens_bibliography "Charles Dickens
bibliography")

Dickens published well over a dozen major novels and novellas, a large number
of short stories, including a number of Christmas-themed stories, a handful of
plays, and several non-fiction books. Dickens's novels were initially
serialised in weekly and monthly magazines, then reprinted in standard book
formats.

  * _[The Pickwick Papers](/wiki/The_Pickwick_Papers "The Pickwick Papers")_ (_The Posthumous Papers of the Pickwick Club_ ; monthly serial, April 1836 to November 1837)[181]
  * _[Oliver Twist](/wiki/Oliver_Twist "Oliver Twist")_ (_The Adventures of Oliver Twist_ ; monthly serial in [Bentley's Miscellany](/wiki/Bentley%27s_Miscellany "Bentley's Miscellany"), February 1837 to April 1839)
  * _[Nicholas Nickleby](/wiki/Nicholas_Nickleby "Nicholas Nickleby")_ (_The Life and Adventures of Nicholas Nickleby_ ; monthly serial, April 1838 to October 1839)
  * _[The Old Curiosity Shop](/wiki/The_Old_Curiosity_Shop "The Old Curiosity Shop")_ (weekly serial in [Master Humphrey's Clock](/wiki/Master_Humphrey%27s_Clock "Master Humphrey's Clock"), April 1840 to November 1841)
  * _[Barnaby Rudge](/wiki/Barnaby_Rudge "Barnaby Rudge")_ (_Barnaby Rudge: A Tale of the Riots of Eighty_ ; weekly serial in [Master Humphrey's Clock](/wiki/Master_Humphrey%27s_Clock "Master Humphrey's Clock"), February to November 1841)
  * _[A Christmas Carol](/wiki/A_Christmas_Carol "A Christmas Carol")_ (_A Christmas Carol in Prose: Being a Ghost-story of Christmas_ ; 1843)
  * _[Martin Chuzzlewit](/wiki/Martin_Chuzzlewit "Martin Chuzzlewit")_ (_The Life and Adventures of Martin Chuzzlewit_ ; monthly serial, January 1843 to July 1844)
  * _[The Chimes](/wiki/The_Chimes "The Chimes")_ (_The Chimes: A Goblin Story of Some Bells That Rang an Old Year Out and a New Year In_ ; 1844)
  * _[The Cricket on the Hearth](/wiki/The_Cricket_on_the_Hearth "The Cricket on the Hearth")_ (_The Cricket on the Hearth: A Fairy Tale of Home_ ; 1845)
  * _[Dombey and Son](/wiki/Dombey_and_Son "Dombey and Son")_ (_Dealings with the Firm of Dombey and Son: Wholesale, Retail and for Exportation_ ; monthly serial, October 1846 to April 1848)
  * _[The Haunted Man](/wiki/The_Haunted_Man_and_the_Ghost%27s_Bargain "The Haunted Man and the Ghost's Bargain")_ (_The Haunted Man and the Ghost 's Bargain: A Fancy for Christmas-time_; 1848)
  * _[David Copperfield](/wiki/David_Copperfield "David Copperfield")_ (_The Personal History, Adventures, Experience and Observation of David Copperfield the Younger of Blunderstone Rookery [Which He Never Meant to Publish on Any Account]_ ; monthly serial, May 1849 to November 1850)
  * _[Bleak House](/wiki/Bleak_House "Bleak House")_ (monthly serial, March 1852 to September 1853)
  * _[Hard Times](/wiki/Hard_Times_\(novel\) "Hard Times \(novel\)")_ (_Hard Times: For These Times_ ; weekly serial in [Household Words](/wiki/Household_Words "Household Words"), 1 April 1854, to 12 August 1854)
  * _[Little Dorrit](/wiki/Little_Dorrit "Little Dorrit")_ (monthly serial, December 1855 to June 1857)
  * _[A Tale of Two Cities](/wiki/A_Tale_of_Two_Cities "A Tale of Two Cities")_ (weekly serial in [All the Year Round](/wiki/All_the_Year_Round "All the Year Round"), 30 April 1859, to 26 November 1859)
  * _[Great Expectations](/wiki/Great_Expectations "Great Expectations")_ (weekly serial in [All the Year Round](/wiki/All_the_Year_Round "All the Year Round"), 1 December 1860 to 3 August 1861)
  * _[Our Mutual Friend](/wiki/Our_Mutual_Friend "Our Mutual Friend")_ (monthly serial, May 1864 to November 1865)
  * _[The Signal-Man](/wiki/The_Signal-Man "The Signal-Man")_ (1866), first published as part of the _[Mugby Junction](/wiki/Mugby_Junction "Mugby Junction")_ collection in the 1866 Christmas edition of _[All the Year Round](/wiki/All_the_Year_Round "All the Year Round")_.
  * _[Edwin Drood](/wiki/The_Mystery_of_Edwin_Drood "The Mystery of Edwin Drood")_ (_The Mystery of Edwin Drood_ ; monthly serial, April 1870 to September 1870), left unfinished due to Dickens's death
